docs.abstract: Every Tuesday and Friday, Ezra Klein invites you into a conversation about something that matters, like today’s episode with Felicia Wong. Listen wherever you get your podcasts.
docs.lead_paragraph: Every Tuesday and Friday, Ezra Klein invites you into a conversation about something that matters, like today’s episode with Felicia Wong. Listen wherever you get your podcasts.

headline.main: Transcript: Ezra Klein Interviews Felicia Wong

docs.abstract: A new Blu-ray box set collects the feature films and shorts of the director, who died this week at 89.
docs.snippet: A new Blu-ray box set collects the feature films and shorts of the director, who died this week at 89.
docs.lead_paragraph: Melvin Van Peebles was a lot of things — filmmaker, novelist, musician, playwright, painter, stock options trader, raconteur — but above all else, he was a showman, a masterful self-promoter and unapologetic huckster. When he died Tuesday at 89, he was a week from the release of the Criterion Collection’s new box set “Melvin Van Peebles: Essential Films” (available on Blu-ray Sept. 28), and Van Peebles, who always displayed a sharp sense of humor about himself and the world around him, might have appreciated the timing — his passing also served as one last act of ballyhoo for the man and his work.

headline.main: Watching the Films of Melvin Van Peebles

docs.abstract: Germany’s election is neck and neck.
docs.snippet: Germany’s election is neck and neck.
docs.lead_paragraph: Early exit polls showed a tight race after Germans voted on a new Parliament. Their choice will determine who succeeds Chancellor Angela Merkel at the helm of the E.U.’s most populous democracy. Here are the latest updates.

docs.abstract: Terence Blanchard, best known for scoring Spike Lee films, reopens the 138-year-old opera company with “Fire Shut Up in My Bones.”
docs.snippet: Terence Blanchard, best known for scoring Spike Lee films, reopens the 138-year-old opera company with “Fire Shut Up in My Bones.”
docs.lead_paragraph: In 1919, William Grant Still was in his 20s — many years from the eminence he would later enjoy as the widely acknowledged “dean” of Black American composers.

headline.main: A Black Composer Finally Arrives at the Metropolitan Opera
headline.print_headline: After 138 Years, the Met Found Him a Seat

docs.abstract: The Texas abortion law is just an early salvo in a broader push by conservatives to restrict the rights of their neighbors, classmates and colleagues.
docs.snippet: The Texas abortion law is just an early salvo in a broader push by conservatives to restrict the rights of their neighbors, classmates and colleagues.
docs.lead_paragraph: In the seemingly endless battle to deny disfavored groups equal citizenship, Republican lawmakers around the country have repurposed an old tool to new and cruel effect. They’ve inverted private enforcement laws — marshaled over the years to discipline fraudulent government contractors, racist or sexist bosses and toxic polluters — to enable individuals to suppress the rights of their neighbors, classmates and colleagues. Most prominent among these new laws is SB 8, Texas’s heartbeat bill. The law bans abortions six weeks into a pregnancy, lets anyone bring a lawsuit against medical practitioners who violate the ban and provides cash bounties of at least $10,000 (plus legal fees and costs) to encourage such litigation.

headline.main: We Are Becoming a Nation of Vigilantes

byline.original: By Jon Michaels and David Noll

docs.abstract: This month’s picks include a slow-burn Romanian drama, a documentary about baseball in Japan, an experimental Chilean film-memoir and more.
docs.snippet: This month’s picks include a slow-burn Romanian drama, a documentary about baseball in Japan, an experimental Chilean film-memoir and more.
docs.lead_paragraph: Following an intelligence officer whose son goes missing on a blizzard-stricken mountain, this slow-burning Romanian film deepens familiar Hollywood templates — a father’s relentless quest to save his child; a battle of man against nature — into a complex ethical drama about the blurred lines between desperation and hubris. When Mircea Jianu (Adrian Titieni) first learns of his son’s disappearance, his reactions are what one would expect from any parent in his shoes: panic, despair, anger. He insists on following the rescue team up the slopes, despite the inclement weather, and lashes out at their seeming slowness.

headline.main: Stream These Five International Films Now
headline.print_headline: Intrigue and More, Far From Hollywood

docs.abstract: After a pandemic-mandated pause, the singer and guitarist’s Lights On Festival brings an R&B showcase to California and Brooklyn this fall.

docs.lead_paragraph: It was going to be the start of something big.

headline.main: As Concerts Resume, H.E.R. Will Headline Two Festivals of Her Own

docs.abstract: The decals, with messages such as “Stop Hate” and “Black Lives Matter,” are part of the league’s efforts to show solidarity with players who have protested against racism and police brutality.
docs.snippet: The decals, with messages such as “Stop Hate” and “Black Lives Matter,” are part of the league’s efforts to show solidarity with players who have protested against racism and police brutality.
docs.lead_paragraph: The N.F.L. will allow players to display messages of social justice on their helmets and will stencil the slogans “It Takes All of Us” and “End Racism” on the end zones at every field as part of an effort to show solidarity with the protest movements against racism and police brutality, league officials said.

headline.main: N.F.L. Will Allow Six Social Justice Messages on Players’ Helmets

docs.abstract: Twenty-two women have filed civil lawsuits in Texas accusing the quarterback of a pattern of coercive and lewd behavior.
docs.snippet: Twenty-two women have filed civil lawsuits in Texas accusing the quarterback of a pattern of coercive and lewd behavior.
docs.lead_paragraph: Houston Texans quarterback Deshaun Watson is the subject of 22 civil suits filed in March and April that accuse him of coercive and lewd sexual behavior, with two that allege sexual assault. He has not been charged criminally and his lawyer has denied the accusations. Here’s where the cases stand.

headline.main: What to Know About the Sexual Misconduct Lawsuits Against Deshaun Watson

docs.abstract: Anthony Davis’s “X,” which premiered in the 1980s, will be revived in New York in fall 2023.
docs.snippet: Anthony Davis’s “X,” which premiered in the 1980s, will be revived in New York in fall 2023.
docs.lead_paragraph: It took 138 years for the Metropolitan Opera to present its first work by a Black composer: Terence Blanchard’s “Fire Shut Up in My Bones,” which opens its season on Sept. 27.

headline.main: A Malcolm X Opera Will Come to the Met
